EMPLOYMENT IN SILVERDALE
A major source of female employment within the village is the staffing of homes and nursing homes for the elderly. Most of the residents for these come from outside the village. There are six such homes at the moment with another large one planned. These homes are the probable reason why Silverdale has the highest death rate in the County. Other employment is provided by tourism, farming (dairy and sheep), two garden centres, coach hire, a garage, agricultural contracting, hairdressing, two doctors surgeries, a bank, fourteen shops, three cafes, a restuarant, one inn, two hotels, a craft centre and a golf club.
